title: Fix TypeAdapterRuntimeTypeWrapper not detecting reflective TreeTypeAdapter and FutureTypeAdapter
body:
Fixes #543
Fixes #2032
Fixes #1833

Previously on serialization TypeAdapterRuntimeTypeWrapper preferred a TreeTypeAdapter without `serializer` which falls back to the reflective adapter.
This behavior was incorrect because it caused the reflective adapter for a Base class to be used for serialization (indirectly as TreeTypeAdapter delegate) instead of using the reflective adapter for a Subclass extending Base.

resolved_issues.title: TypeAdapterRuntimeTypeWrapper prefers cyclic adapter for base type over reflective adapter for sub type

hints:
Consider using the following names for the new files:
1. gson/src/main/java/com/google/gson/internal/bind/SerializationDelegatingTypeAdapter.java
Consider using the following identifiers for the new entities:
1. com: The identifier 'com' denotes the base package path for custom type adapters and functional tests in Gson, consistently serving as the namespace for implementation and verification of serialization logic.
2. google: The identifier 'google' represents the root package namespace for all custom Gson framework classes and test cases, and should be used to organize source and test code for the Gson library.
3. TypeAdapter: TypeAdapter is a core abstraction for converting between Java objects and their JSON representation, allowing custom serialization and deserialization logic to be implemented and registered for specific types.

title: Fix #1702: Gson.toJson creates CharSequence which does not implement toString

resolved_issues.title: Gson.toJson: CharSequence passed to Appendable does not implement toString()

title: Fixed nullSafe usage.
body:
It is impossible to create a JsonDeserializer that transforms JSON null values. This PR makes it so that a serializer/deserializer for annotated field does get called on nulls when `nullSafe` property of JsonAdapter annotation is false.

nullSafe is still ignored if adapter is registered via GsonBuilder.

Fixes #1553

Signed-off-by: Dmitry Bufistov <dmitry@midokura.com>

resolved_issues.title: JsonAdapter nullSafe parameter is ignored by JsonSerializer/JsonDeserializer type adapters
resolved_issues.body:
Hi there,

It looks like gson uses TreeTypeAdapter for JsonSerializer/JsonDeserializer type adapters.
TreeTypeAdapter is always nullSafe, so nullSafe value of JsonAdapter annotation is ignored in this case which is at least confusing.

I fixed this locally by adding nullSafe parameter to the TreeTypeAdapter and would love to submit a PR if it need be. Shall I go ahead?

Thanks!

hints:
Consider using the following identifiers for the new entities:
1. nullSafe: The identifier 'nullSafe' specifies whether JSON serialization and deserialization operations should handle null values safely, controlling null-check behavior in custom adapter implementations.

title: Fix issue with recursive type variable protections to fix #1390
body:
When a type variable is referenced multiple times it needs to resolve to the same value.  Previously, the second attempt would abort resolution early in order to protect against infinite recursion.

NOTE: I could use some scrutiny on this as I don't fully understand the implications of all the code branches.  This commit does resolve the issue but stylistically I'm not really sold on breaking out of the while loop in order to capture the final result for subsequent resolution attempts.

Fixes #1390

resolved_issues.title: Recursive TypeVariable resolution results in ClassCastException when type var is referenced multiple times

title: value(double) can write NaN and infinite values when lenient, as value(Number) does

resolved_issues.title: JsonWriter#value(java.lang.Number) can be lenient, but JsonWriter#value(double) can't,
